alert.note: Alert for Linn (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 5:25AM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Linn, southeastern Cass, Henry and Bates Counties through 600 AM CDT... At 525 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Butler, moving southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clinton, Butler, Adrian, Rich Hill, Pleasanton, Mound City, Urich, Calhoun, Deepwater, Montrose, Creighton, Hume, Blue Mound, Prescott, Coal, Amoret, Rockville, Foster, Brownington and Blairstown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
